blocks.title: Introduced top-level await
paragraphs: Prior to this, the await keyword could only be used inside async functions, and a syntax error would occur if forced: await is only valid in async functions and the top level bodies of modules
It is now possible to use await at the top level of a file, which will be treated as an ECMAScript module. Here is the official example:

blocks.title: The at method for Strings, Arrays, and TypedArrays
paragraphs: The at() method solves the very practical problem that all basic indexable classes (Array, String, TypedArray) can be "negatively indexed", just like in Python. It's a more general approach, which is to allow relative indexing.

paragraphs: Object.hasOwn is a convenient alternative to Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty. I covered it in great detail in a previous article. Lorem ipsum dolor sit, amet consectetur adipisicing elit.
